questions.question: Which engine uses Blueprints for visual scripting?
questions.correctAnswer: Unreal Engine

questions.question: What is the primary language used in Unity?
questions.correctAnswer: C#

questions.question: What is a 'Sprite'?
options: A 2D image or animation integrated into a larger scene
questions.correctAnswer: A 2D image or animation integrated into a larger scene

questions.question: What does FPS stand for in gaming?
options: Both A and B depending on context
questions.correctAnswer: Both A and B depending on context

questions.question: What is a 'Mesh'?
options: A collection of vertices, edges, and faces that define the shape of a 3D object
questions.correctAnswer: A collection of vertices, edges, and faces that define the shape of a 3D object

questions.question: What is a 'collider' used for?
options: To detect physical collisions between objects
questions.correctAnswer: To detect physical collisions between objects

questions.question: What is 'Raycasting'?
options: Shooting an invisible line from a point in a direction to detect what it hits
questions.correctAnswer: Shooting an invisible line from a point in a direction to detect what it hits

questions.question: What is a 'Prefab' in Unity?
options: A reusable asset that contains a GameObject and its components
questions.correctAnswer: A reusable asset that contains a GameObject and its components

questions.question: What is 'NavMesh' used for?
questions.correctAnswer: Pathfinding for AI agents

questions.question: What is a 'Skybox'?
options: A cube with textures on the inside faces to create a background environment
questions.correctAnswer: A cube with textures on the inside faces to create a background environment

questions.question: What is 'Delta Time'?
options: The time difference between the last frame and the current frame
questions.correctAnswer: The time difference between the last frame and the current frame

questions.question: What is the difference between 'Start' and 'Awake' in Unity?
options: Awake is called when the script instance is being loaded, Start is called before the first frame update
questions.correctAnswer: Awake is called when the script instance is being loaded, Start is called before the first frame update

questions.question: What is 'Rigging'?
options: Creating a skeleton for a 3D model so it can be moved/animated
questions.correctAnswer: Creating a skeleton for a 3D model so it can be moved/animated

questions.question: What is 'LOD'?
questions.correctAnswer: Level of Detail

questions.question: What is 'Draw Call'?
options: A command sent by the CPU to the GPU to render a mesh
questions.correctAnswer: A command sent by the CPU to the GPU to render a mesh

questions.question: What is 'Normal Map'?
options: A texture used to add surface detail without adding geometry
questions.correctAnswer: A texture used to add surface detail without adding geometry

questions.question: What is 'Quaternion' used for?
options: Representing rotations to avoid gimbal lock
questions.correctAnswer: Representing rotations to avoid gimbal lock

questions.question: What is 'Occlusion Culling'?
options: Not rendering objects that are hidden behind other objects
questions.correctAnswer: Not rendering objects that are hidden behind other objects

questions.question: What is a 'State Machine'?
options: A behavioral model that consists of a finite number of states, transitions, and actions
questions.correctAnswer: A behavioral model that consists of a finite number of states, transitions, and actions

questions.question: What is 'Physics.Raycast' output?
options: Information about what the ray hit (RaycastHit)
questions.correctAnswer: Information about what the ray hit (RaycastHit)

questions.question: What is 'Object Pooling'?
options: Reusing objects from a pool instead of destroying and instantiating them repeatedly
questions.correctAnswer: Reusing objects from a pool instead of destroying and instantiating them repeatedly

questions.question: What is 'Linear Interpolation' (Lerp)?
options: Finding a value between two points based on a percentage
questions.correctAnswer: Finding a value between two points based on a percentage

questions.question: What is 'Anti-Aliasing'?
options: Smoothing jagged edges on curved lines and diagonals
questions.correctAnswer: Smoothing jagged edges on curved lines and diagonals

questions.question: What is a 'Shader'?
options: A program that runs on the GPU to determine how to render graphics
questions.correctAnswer: A program that runs on the GPU to determine how to render graphics

questions.question: What is the difference between Update and FixedUpdate?
options: Update runs once per frame, FixedUpdate runs at a fixed interval (for physics)
questions.correctAnswer: Update runs once per frame, FixedUpdate runs at a fixed interval (for physics)

questions.question: What is 'Gimbal Lock'?
options: Loss of one degree of freedom in a three-dimensional, three-gimbal mechanism
questions.correctAnswer: Loss of one degree of freedom in a three-dimensional, three-gimbal mechanism

questions.question: What is 'Baked Lighting'?
options: Pre-calculating lighting and storing it in lightmaps (textures)
questions.correctAnswer: Pre-calculating lighting and storing it in lightmaps (textures)

questions.question: Who created C++?
questions.correctAnswer: Bjarne Stroustrup

questions.question: What is 'Entity Component System' (ECS)?
options: An architectural pattern where data (Components) is separated from logic (Systems) and identity (Entities)
questions.correctAnswer: An architectural pattern where data (Components) is separated from logic (Systems) and identity (Entities)

questions.question: What is 'Z-Fighting'?
options: Flickering when two coplanar polygons overlap and the depth buffer cannot distinguish them
questions.correctAnswer: Flickering when two coplanar polygons overlap and the depth buffer cannot distinguish them

questions.question: What is a 'Mipmap'?
options: Pre-calculated, optimized sequences of textures at different resolutions
questions.correctAnswer: Pre-calculated, optimized sequences of textures at different resolutions

questions.question: What is 'Procedural Generation'?
options: Creating data algorithmically rather than manually
questions.correctAnswer: Creating data algorithmically rather than manually

questions.question: What is 'Inverse Kinematics' (IK)?
options: Calculating joint angles to reach a specific end effector position
questions.correctAnswer: Calculating joint angles to reach a specific end effector position

questions.question: What is 'Frustum Culling'?
options: Culling objects outside the camera's view frustum
questions.correctAnswer: Culling objects outside the camera's view frustum

questions.question: What is 'Behavior Tree'?
options: A mathematical model of plan execution used in AI (popular in robotics and games)
questions.correctAnswer: A mathematical model of plan execution used in AI (popular in robotics and games)

questions.question: What is 'Spatial Partitioning'?
options: Dividing space into regions to optimize search/collision (e.g., Quadtree, Octree)
questions.correctAnswer: Dividing space into regions to optimize search/collision (e.g., Quadtree, Octree)

questions.question: What is 'Networking Prediction' (Client-side prediction)?
options: Client simulating effects of inputs before server confirmation to reduce perceived lag
questions.correctAnswer: Client simulating effects of inputs before server confirmation to reduce perceived lag

questions.question: What is 'Dead Reckoning'?
options: Predicting the current position of an object based on its last known position and velocity
questions.correctAnswer: Predicting the current position of an object based on its last known position and velocity

questions.question: What is 'Ambient Occlusion'?
options: Shading method to approximate how exposed each point in a scene is to ambient lighting
questions.correctAnswer: Shading method to approximate how exposed each point in a scene is to ambient lighting

questions.question: What is 'Garbage Collection' impact on games?
options: Can cause frame rate spikes (stutter) if it runs during gameplay
questions.correctAnswer: Can cause frame rate spikes (stutter) if it runs during gameplay

questions.question: What is 'Vertex Shader'?
options: Shader stage that processes individual vertices
questions.correctAnswer: Shader stage that processes individual vertices

questions.question: What is 'Fragment (Pixel) Shader'?
options: Shader stage that computes the color of individual pixels
questions.correctAnswer: Shader stage that computes the color of individual pixels

questions.question: What is 'TCP vs UDP' preference in fast-paced multiplayer games?
options: UDP is preferred for speed and lower latency, even if some packets are lost
questions.correctAnswer: UDP is preferred for speed and lower latency, even if some packets are lost

questions.question: What is 'PBR'?
questions.correctAnswer: Physically Based Rendering

questions.question: What is a 'Texture Atlas'?
options: A large image containing multiple smaller sub-images (sprites/textures)
questions.correctAnswer: A large image containing multiple smaller sub-images (sprites/textures)

questions.question: What is 'Lag Compensation'?
options: Techniques to mitigate the effects of network latency
questions.correctAnswer: Techniques to mitigate the effects of network latency

questions.question: What is 'Instancing'?
options: Rendering multiple copies of the same mesh in a single draw call
questions.correctAnswer: Rendering multiple copies of the same mesh in a single draw call

questions.question: What is 'Asset Bundle (Unity)' or 'DLC'?
options: Archive files containing assets that can be loaded at runtime
questions.correctAnswer: Archive files containing assets that can be loaded at runtime

questions.question: What is 'Stencil Buffer'?
options: A buffer used to limit the area of rendering (masking)
questions.correctAnswer: A buffer used to limit the area of rendering (masking)

questions.question: What is 'DOTS' (Data-Oriented Technology Stack) in Unity?
options: A stack designed for high performance using ECS, Job System, and Burst Compiler
questions.correctAnswer: A stack designed for high performance using ECS, Job System, and Burst Compiler
